meanings.definition: Obtundents: substances that dull or lessen the sensitivity of nerves
meanings.sent1: The obtundents in the medicine helped reduce the pain in my arm.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often use obtundents to make patients more comfortable during procedures.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled obtundents on my hand, and now I can't feel a thing!
meanings.sent4: The music acted as an obtundent, soothing my nerves and calming my mind.
meanings.sent5: The obtundents in the lotion made my skin feel pleasantly numb.

meanings.definition: Obtundents: agents used to reduce pain or irritation

meanings.sent2: Pharmacists often recommend obtundents for minor cuts and scrapes.
meanings.sent3: The obtundents in the cream made the mosquito bite stop itching instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words acted as an obtundent, soothing the hurt feelings.
meanings.sent5: The obtundents in the eye drops helped relieve the irritation quickly.

meanings.definition: Obtundents: medications that numb or desensitize a specific area
meanings.sent1: The dentist applied obtundents to my gums before the procedure.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often use obtundents to temporarily numb sore muscles.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally touched the obtundents with my tongue, and now my mouth feels funny.
meanings.sent4: The cold wind acted as an obtundent, numbing my cheeks as I walked.
meanings.sent5: The obtundents in the spray helped numb the area before the injection.
